name: gimp

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: jpegxl
variants.description: Build with JPEG XL image format support

variants.name: libmng
variants.description: Build with Multiple-Image Network Graphics support

variants.name: libwmf
variants.description: Build with libwmf Windows Windows Metafile Format (WMF) support

description:
GIMP is a cross-platform image editor available for GNU/Linux, macOS,
Windows and more operating systems. It is free software, you can change
its source code and distribute your changes. Whether you are a graphic
designer, photographer, illustrator, or scientist, GIMP provides you
with sophisticated tools to get your job done. You can further enhance
your productivity with GIMP thanks to many customization options and 3rd
party plugins.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries

dependencies.name: babl
dependencies.description:
babl is pixel encoding and color space conversion engine in C. It allows
converting between different methods of storing pixels known as pixel
formats that have with different bitdepths and other data
representations, color models, color spaces and component permutations.

dependencies.name: fontconfig
dependencies.description: Fontconfig is a library for configuring/customizing font access

dependencies.name: gegl
dependencies.description:
GEGL (Generic Graphics Library) is a data flow based image processing
framework, providing floating point processing and non-destructive image
processing capabilities to GNU Image Manipulation Program and other
projects (imgflo, GNOME Photos, iconographer, ...)

dependencies.name: gexiv2
dependencies.description:
gexiv2 is a GObject wrapper around the Exiv2 photo metadata library. It
allows for GNOME applications to easily inspect and update EXIF, IPTC,
and XMP metadata in photo and video files of various formats.

dependencies.name: ghostscript
dependencies.description: An interpreter for the PostScript language and for PDF.

dependencies.name: glib
dependencies.description:
GLib provides the core application building blocks for libraries and
applications written in C. The GLib package contains a low-level
libraries useful for providing data structure handling for C,
portability wrappers and interfaces for such runtime functionality as an
event loop, threads, dynamic loading and an object system.

dependencies.name: glib-networking
dependencies.description: Network-related giomodules for glib.

dependencies.name: gtk-doc
dependencies.description:
GtkDoc is a tool used to extract API documentation from C-code like
Doxygen, but handles documentation of GObject (including signals and
properties) that makes it very suitable for GTK+ apps and libraries. It
uses docbook for intermediate files and can produce html by default and
pdf/man-pages with some extra work.

dependencies.name: gtkplus
dependencies.description:
The GTK+ package contains libraries used for creating graphical user
interfaces for applications.

dependencies.name: intltool
dependencies.description:
intltool is a set of tools to centralize translation of many different
file formats using GNU gettext-compatible PO files.

dependencies.name: jpeg
dependencies.description:
libjpeg-turbo is a fork of the original IJG libjpeg which uses SIMD to
accelerate baseline JPEG compression and decompression. libjpeg is a
library that implements JPEG image encoding, decoding and transcoding.

dependencies.name: libexif
dependencies.description: A library to parse an EXIF file and read the data from those tags

dependencies.name: libjxl
dependencies.description: JPEG XL image format reference implementation.

dependencies.name: libmng
dependencies.description:
THE reference library for reading, displaying, writing and examining
Multiple-Image Network Graphics. MNG is the animation extension to the
popular PNG image format.

dependencies.name: libmypaint
dependencies.description:
libmypaint - MyPaint brush engine library. This is the brush library
used by MyPaint. A number of other painting programs use it too.

dependencies.name: libpng
dependencies.description: libpng is the official PNG reference library.

dependencies.name: librsvg
dependencies.description: Library to render SVG files using Cairo

dependencies.name: libtiff
dependencies.description: LibTIFF - Tag Image File Format (TIFF) Library and Utilities.

dependencies.name: libwmf
dependencies.description:
libwmf is a library for reading vector images in Microsft's native
Windows Metafile Format (WMF)

dependencies.name: libwebp
dependencies.description:
WebP is a modern image format that provides superior lossless and lossy
compression for images on the web. Using WebP, webmasters and web
developers can create smaller, richer images that make the web faster.

dependencies.name: libxcursor
dependencies.description: libXcursor - X Window System Cursor management library.

dependencies.name: libxpm
dependencies.description: libXpm - X Pixmap (XPM) image file format library.

dependencies.name: mypaint-brushes
dependencies.description: Brushes used by MyPaint and other software using libmypaint.

dependencies.name: openexr
dependencies.description: OpenEXR Graphics Tools (high dynamic-range image file format)

dependencies.name: openjpeg
dependencies.description:
OpenJPEG is an open-source JPEG 2000 codec written in C language. It has
been developed in order to promote the use of JPEG 2000, a still-image
compression standard from the Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG).
Since April 2015, it is officially recognized by ISO/IEC and ITU-T as a
JPEG 2000 Reference Software.

dependencies.name: pango
dependencies.description:
Pango is a library for laying out and rendering of text, with an
emphasis on internationalization. It can be used anywhere that text
layout is needed, though most of the work on Pango so far has been done
in the context of the GTK+ widget toolkit.

dependencies.name: poppler
dependencies.description: Poppler is a PDF rendering library based on the xpdf-3.0 code base.

dependencies.name: poppler-data
dependencies.description:
This package consists of encoding files for use with poppler. The
encoding files are optional and poppler will automatically read them if
they are present. When installed, the encoding files enables poppler to
correctly render CJK and Cyrrilic properly. While poppler is licensed
under the GPL, these encoding files have different license, and thus
distributed separately.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.
